UPDATE

The first day of school for the 2020-21 academic year has been moved from Thursday, August 13 to Monday, August 24. Instruction for all grade levels will occur through our “Pivot to Home” plan and students will not be in the classroom with their teachers during this time.

This difficult decision was made after evaluating guidance and data from the Oklahoma State Department of Health and the Oklahoma State Department of Education. Since we first communicated with you about return to school procedures back on July 14, our county has continued to show weekly increases in cases of COVID-19 and our local health leaders have urged us to consider learning options other than the traditional classroom setting.

This decision comes with the goal of protecting our students, staff and community, while also providing the best educational experience possible.

For more information: https://bit.ly/2XnUaNk

This month’s character trait is Flexibility, which is defined as willingness to change plans or ideas without getting upset. A person must adjust to the changes life brings. Many try to rearrange others or insulate themselves from disappointment, but flexibility does not involve controlling the outcome or avoiding commitment. Flexibility begins with clear vision and a willingness to apply principles of good character in each situation, regardless of the unique circumstance of that situation. When the unexpected or the inconvenient happens, we must take responsibility and adapt to complete our goal

Today's #ThrowbackThursday takes us to the fall of 1974 when Owasso earned its first state football championship! The Rams defeated Jenks, Idabel and Bartlesville in the playoffs before a state championship matchup with Ada. The final game ended in a 7-7 tie, as there were no overtime rules at the time, and both teams were eventually awarded a gold ball.

From the 1974-75 write-up in the OHS "Trail's End" yearbook: "As the game ended, the score was still 7-7. The fans and team didn't know whether to be happy or sad. It was not until several hours later when Coach Harper received a phone call from Oklahoma City that we were STATE CHAMPS!!!"

Photos courtesy of Owasso Historical Museum.

It's our first #ThrowbackThursday so why not throw it all the way back to the beginning? The first public school in Owasso was the Buff School Building, which was built on land donated by Benton Boes (on Broadway and west of Birch) in 1909. In March of 1910, the site was visited by the County School Superintendent, who declared that it was "the best country school in the state." In July of 1947, a tornado blew out the top floor and the building was repaired into a two-story structure. It was used until 1977, when it was torn down.

Photo courtesy of Owasso Historical Museum.

shared_text:
Owasso Character Council
December 1, 2019 at 9:00 AM ·

This month’s character trait is Generosity, which is defined as carefully managing my resources so I can freely give to those in need. Generosity can inspire individuals to reach their full potential and benefit others in turn. It is not limited to a particular time of day or season of the year. Generosity is an attitude that does not begrudge others what they have and seeks to benefit others in ways appropriate to their needs. Well-ordered giving has a multiplying effect that allows each person involved to grow. These benefits spread out in all directions, creating similar benefits in others’ lives, and eventually finding their way back to the original giver. We can experience satisfaction by generously helping others.
#Generosity #CharacterMatters #OwassoCharacter #CharacterTraits
